verses.verse: I am the <S%H1397>man<s%> that hath <S%H7200>seen<s%> <S%H6040>affliction<s%> by the <S%H7626>rod<s%> of his <S%H5678>wrath<s%>.
He hath <S%H5090>led<s%> me, and <S%H3212>brought<s%> me into <S%H2822>darkness<s%>, but not into <S%H216>light<s%>.
Surely against me is he <S%H7725>turned<s%>; he <S%H2015>turneth<s%> his <S%H3027>hand<s%> against me all the <S%H3117>day<s%>.
My <S%H1320>flesh<s%> and my <S%H5785>skin<s%> hath he made <S%H1086>old<s%>; he hath <S%H7665>broken<s%> my <S%H6106>bones<s%>.
He hath builded <S%H1129>against<s%> me, and <S%H5362>compassed<s%> me with <S%H7219>gall<s%> and <S%H8513>travail<s%>.
He hath <S%H3427>set<s%> me in dark <S%H4285>places<s%>, as they that be <S%H4191>dead<s%> of <S%H5769>old<s%>.
He hath <S%H1443>hedged<s%> me about, that I cannot get <S%H3318>out<s%>: he hath made my <S%H5178>chain<s%> <S%H3513>heavy<s%>.
Also when I <S%H2199>cry<s%> and <S%H7768>shout<s%>, he shutteth <S%H5640>out<s%> my <S%H8605>prayer<s%>.
He hath <S%H1443>inclosed<s%> my <S%H1870>ways<s%> with hewn <S%H1496>stone<s%>, he hath made my <S%H5410>paths<s%> <S%H5753>crooked<s%>.
He was unto me as a <S%H1677>bear<s%> lying in <S%H693>wait<s%>, and as a <S%H738>lion<s%> in secret <S%H4565>places<s%>.
He hath turned <S%H5493>aside<s%> my <S%H1870>ways<s%>, and pulled me in <S%H6582>pieces<s%>: he hath <S%H7760>made<s%> me <S%H8074>desolate<s%>.
He hath <S%H1869>bent<s%> his <S%H7198>bow<s%>, and <S%H5324>set<s%> me as a <S%H4307>mark<s%> for the <S%H2671>arrow<s%>.
He hath caused the <S%H1121>arrows<s%> of his <S%H827>quiver<s%> to <S%H935>enter<s%> into my <S%H3629>reins<s%>. arrows: Heb. sons
I was a <S%H7814>derision<s%> to all my <S%H5971>people<s%>; and their <S%H5058>song<s%> all the <S%H3117>day<s%>.
He hath <S%H7646>filled<s%> me with <S%H4844>bitterness<s%>, he hath made me <S%H7301>drunken<s%> with <S%H3939>wormwood<s%>. bitterness: Heb. bitternesses
He hath also <S%H1638>broken<s%> my <S%H8127>teeth<s%> with gravel <S%H2687>stones<s%>, he hath <S%H3728>covered<s%> me with <S%H665>ashes<s%>. covered: or, rolled me in the ashes
And thou hast <S%H2186>removed<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%> far <S%H2186>off<s%> from <S%H7965>peace<s%>: I <S%H5382>forgat<s%> <S%H2896>prosperity<s%>. prosperity: Heb. good
And I <S%H559>said<s%>, My <S%H5331>strength<s%> and my <S%H8431>hope<s%> is <S%H6>perished<s%> from the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>:
<S%H2142>Remembering<s%> mine <S%H6040>affliction<s%> and my <S%H4788>misery<s%>, the <S%H3939>wormwood<s%> and the <S%H7219>gall<s%>. Remembering: or, Remember
My <S%H5315>soul<s%> hath them <S%H2142>still<s%> in <S%H2142>remembrance<s%>, and is <S%H7743>humbled<s%> in me. humbled: Heb. bowed
This I <S%H7725>recall<s%> to my <S%H3820>mind<s%>, therefore have I <S%H3176>hope<s%>. recall: Heb. make to return to my heart
It is of the <S%H3068>LORD'S<s%> <S%H2617>mercies<s%> that we are not <S%H8552>consumed<s%>, because his <S%H7356>compassions<s%> <S%H3615>fail<s%> not.
They are <S%H2319>new<s%> every <S%H1242>morning<s%>: <S%H7227>great<s%> is thy <S%H530>faithfulness<s%>.
The <S%H3068>LORD<s%> is my <S%H2506>portion<s%>, <S%H559>saith<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%>; therefore will I <S%H3176>hope<s%> in him.
The <S%H3068>LORD<s%> is <S%H2896>good<s%> unto them that <S%H6960>wait<s%> for him, to the <S%H5315>soul<s%> that <S%H1875>seeketh<s%> him.
It is <S%H2896>good<s%> that a man should both <S%H3175>hope<s%> <S%H2342><s%> and quietly <S%H1748>wait<s%> for the <S%H8668>salvation<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>.
It is <S%H2896>good<s%> for a <S%H1397>man<s%> that he <S%H5375>bear<s%> the <S%H5923>yoke<s%> in his <S%H5271>youth<s%>.
He <S%H3427>sitteth<s%> <S%H910>alone<s%> and keepeth <S%H1826>silence<s%>, because he hath <S%H5190>borne<s%> it upon him.
He <S%H5414>putteth<s%> his <S%H6310>mouth<s%> in the <S%H6083>dust<s%>; if so be there may <S%H3426>be<s%> <S%H8615>hope<s%>.
He <S%H5414>giveth<s%> his <S%H3895>cheek<s%> to him that <S%H5221>smiteth<s%> him: he is filled <S%H7646>full<s%> with <S%H2781>reproach<s%>.
For the <S%H136>Lord<s%> will not cast <S%H2186>off<s%> for <S%H5769>ever<s%>:
But though he cause <S%H3013>grief<s%>, yet will he have <S%H7355>compassion<s%> according to the <S%H7230>multitude<s%> of his <S%H2617>mercies<s%>.
For he doth not <S%H6031>afflict<s%> <S%H3820>willingly<s%> nor <S%H3013>grieve<s%> the <S%H1121>children<s%> of <S%H376>men<s%>. willingly: Heb. from his heart
To <S%H1792>crush<s%> under his <S%H7272>feet<s%> all the <S%H615>prisoners<s%> of the <S%H776>earth<s%>,
To turn <S%H5186>aside<s%> the <S%H4941>right<s%> of a <S%H1397>man<s%> before the <S%H6440>face<s%> of the most <S%H5945>High<s%>, the most High: or, a superior
To <S%H5791>subvert<s%> a <S%H120>man<s%> in his <S%H7379>cause<s%>, the <S%H136>Lord<s%> <S%H7200>approveth<s%> not. approveth not: or, seeth not
Who is he that <S%H559>saith<s%>, and it cometh to pass, when the <S%H136>Lord<s%> <S%H6680>commandeth<s%> it not?
Out of the <S%H6310>mouth<s%> of the most <S%H5945>High<s%> <S%H3318>proceedeth<s%> not <S%H7451>evil<s%> and <S%H2896>good<s%>?
Wherefore doth a <S%H2416>living<s%> <S%H120>man<s%> <S%H596>complain<s%>, a <S%H1397>man<s%> for the punishment of his <S%H2399>sins<s%>? complain: or, murmur
Let us <S%H2664>search<s%> and <S%H2713>try<s%> our <S%H1870>ways<s%>, and turn <S%H7725>again<s%> to the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>.
Let us lift <S%H5375>up<s%> our <S%H3824>heart<s%> with our <S%H3709>hands<s%> unto <S%H410>God<s%> in the <S%H8064>heavens<s%>.
<S%H5168>We<s%> have <S%H6586>transgressed<s%> and have <S%H4784>rebelled<s%>: thou hast not <S%H5545>pardoned<s%>.
Thou hast <S%H5526>covered<s%> with <S%H639>anger<s%>, and <S%H7291>persecuted<s%> us: thou hast <S%H2026>slain<s%>, thou hast not <S%H2550>pitied<s%>.
Thou hast <S%H5526>covered<s%> thyself with a <S%H6051>cloud<s%>, that our <S%H8605>prayer<s%> should not pass <S%H5674>through<s%>.
Thou hast <S%H7760>made<s%> us as the <S%H5501>offscouring<s%> and <S%H3973>refuse<s%> in the <S%H7130>midst<s%> of the <S%H5971>people<s%>.
All our <S%H341>enemies<s%> have <S%H6475>opened<s%> their <S%H6310>mouths<s%> against us.
<S%H6343>Fear<s%> and a <S%H6354>snare<s%> is come upon us, <S%H7612>desolation<s%> and <S%H7667>destruction<s%>.
Mine <S%H5869>eye<s%> runneth <S%H3381>down<s%> with <S%H6388>rivers<s%> of <S%H4325>water<s%> for the <S%H7667>destruction<s%> of the <S%H1323>daughter<s%> of my <S%H5971>people<s%>.
Mine <S%H5869>eye<s%> trickleth <S%H5064>down<s%>, and <S%H1820>ceaseth<s%> not, without any <S%H2014>intermission<s%>,
Till the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> look <S%H8259>down<s%>, and <S%H7200>behold<s%> from <S%H8064>heaven<s%>.
Mine <S%H5869>eye<s%> <S%H5953>affecteth<s%> mine <S%H5315>heart<s%> because of all the <S%H1323>daughters<s%> of my <S%H5892>city<s%>. mine heart: Heb. my soul because: or, more than all
Mine <S%H341>enemies<s%> <S%H6679>chased<s%> me <S%H6679>sore<s%>, like a <S%H6833>bird<s%>, without <S%H2600>cause<s%>.
They have cut <S%H6789>off<s%> my <S%H2416>life<s%> in the <S%H953>dungeon<s%>, and <S%H3034>cast<s%> a <S%H68>stone<s%> upon me.
<S%H4325>Waters<s%> flowed <S%H6687>over<s%> mine <S%H7218>head<s%>; then I <S%H559>said<s%>, I am cut <S%H1504>off<s%>.
I <S%H7121>called<s%> upon thy <S%H8034>name<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, out of the <S%H8482>low<s%> <S%H953>dungeon<s%>.
Thou hast <S%H8085>heard<s%> my <S%H6963>voice<s%>: <S%H5956>hide<s%> not thine <S%H241>ear<s%> at my <S%H7309>breathing<s%>, at my <S%H7775>cry<s%>.
Thou drewest <S%H7126>near<s%> in the <S%H3117>day<s%> that I <S%H7121>called<s%> upon thee: thou <S%H559>saidst<s%>, <S%H3372>Fear<s%> not.
O <S%H136>Lord<s%>, thou hast <S%H7378>pleaded<s%> the <S%H7379>causes<s%> of my <S%H5315>soul<s%>; thou hast <S%H1350>redeemed<s%> my <S%H2416>life<s%>.
O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, thou hast <S%H7200>seen<s%> my <S%H5792>wrong<s%>: <S%H8199>judge<s%> thou my <S%H4941>cause<s%>.
Thou hast <S%H7200>seen<s%> all their <S%H5360>vengeance<s%> and all their <S%H4284>imaginations<s%> against me.
Thou hast <S%H8085>heard<s%> their <S%H2781>reproach<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, and all their <S%H4284>imaginations<s%> against me;
The <S%H8193>lips<s%> of those that rose <S%H6965>up<s%> against me, and their <S%H1902>device<s%> against me all the <S%H3117>day<s%>.
<S%H5027>Behold<s%> their sitting <S%H3427>down<s%>, and their rising <S%H7012>up<s%>; I am their <S%H4485>musick<s%>.
<S%H7725>Render<s%> unto them a <S%H1576>recompence<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, according to the <S%H4639>work<s%> of their <S%H3027>hands<s%>.
<S%H5414>Give<s%> them <S%H4044>sorrow<s%> of <S%H3820>heart<s%>, thy <S%H8381>curse<s%> unto them. sorrow: or, obstinacy of heart
<S%H7291>Persecute<s%> and <S%H8045>destroy<s%> them in <S%H639>anger<s%> from under the <S%H8064>heavens<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>.
